definition: to shake/to vibrate/to jolt/to quake/excited/shocked/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing thunder/☳
dawn/morning/daybreak/day/dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
Sinian (c. 800-542 million years ago), late phase of pre-Cambrian geological era
(bird species of China) reed parrotbill (Paradoxornis heudei)

sentences.english: The Pre-Sinian Darezha Formation is widely exposed in west Mianning.
sentences.chinese: 冕寧西部是康滇地區前震旦系出露較集中的地段之一。

sentences.english: The Sinian system was completely developed and well exposed in a wide area of Dongzhi, South Anhui.
sentences.chinese: 皖南東至地區的震旦系發育齊全，分佈廣泛。

sentences.english: This is the evening sunset, we are the rising sun as aurora.
sentences.chinese: 這是黃昏的夕陽，我們卻當做震旦的旭日。

sentences.english: After the Sinian Great Ice Age, the Phanerozoic started.
sentences.chinese: 震旦紀大冰期後開始了顯生宙。

sentences.english: The favorable source beds in this district are Presinian Kangding Group and DengyingFormation of upper Sinian series.
sentences.chinese: 上震旦統燈影組前震旦系康定羣是本區有利礦源層。

sentences.english: The favorable source beds in this district are Presinian Kangding Group and DengyingFormation of upper Sinian series.
sentences.chinese: 上震旦統燈影組前震旦系康定羣是本區有利礦源層。

sentences.english: Zhungeer block is the Pre-Sinian block.
sentences.chinese: 準噶爾地塊爲前震旦紀地塊。

definition: the distant past/ancient times/antiquity/early historical times
Nirvana (in Buddhist scripture)/Lord Brahma (the Hindu Creator)
World Honored One/Revered One of the World (Buddha)
Manes (3rd century AD), Persian prophet and founder of Manichaeism
Mt Meru or Sumeru, sacred mountain in Buddhist and Jain tradition/Mt Xumi in Guyuan 固原[Gu4 yuan2], Ningxia, with many Buddhist cave statues
